contentrichtext.text: '''Zdeněk Kopal''' ({{IPA-cs|ˈzdɛɲɛk ˈkopal}}; April 4, 1914 – June 23, 1993) was a Czech [[astronomer]] who mainly worked in England. Kopal was born and grew up in [[Litomyšl]] ([[Czechoslovakia]], now [[Czech Republic]]). In his early astronomical career, he studied [[variable star]]s and in particular close [[eclipsing binary]] stars. He attended [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge University]] in 1938<ref>{{cite book |title=The Biographical Encyclopedia of Astronomers |last=Hockey |first=Thomas |year=2009 |publisher=[[Springer Publishing]] |isbn=978-0-387-31022-0 |accessdate=August 22, 2012 |url=http://www.springerreference.com/docs/html/chapterdbid/58794.html}}</ref> and later that year he went to [[Harvard College Observatory]]. After the war he became head of the astronomy department at the [[University of Manchester]]. He later assisted [[NASA]] with the [[Apollo program]] as an external expert.<br /> He was Editor-in-Chief of the journal [[Astrophysics and Space Science]] since its foundation in 1968 until his death in 1993. The [[asteroid]] [[2628 Kopal]] was named in his honour. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.litomysl.cz/zdenekkopal/?lang=en Zdeněk Kopal on the website of the town Litomyšl] * [http://www.todayinsci.com/6/6_23.htm Zdeněk Kopal at ''Today in Science History''] {{Authority control|VIAF=110029053}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kopal, Zdenek | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = April 4, 1914 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = June 23, 1993 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kopal, Zdenek}} [[Category:1914 births]] [[Category:1993 deaths]] [[Category:Czech astronomers]] [[Category:Czechoslovak expatriates in the United Kingdom]] {{CzechRepublic-scientist-stub}} {{Europe-astronomer-stub}}
